title: Intentions for the Week
description: Intentions for the Week- Week 22 in 2025 Hi hiiiiii! Welcome to week 22! How was your weekend? Do you have today off? Did you have any time to yourself? (I spent all weekend with family) Did you get to rest? (I had 6AM wakeups all weekend) Did you do meal prep? (I cleaned out the fridge! ) Do you know whatâ€™s for dinner tonight? I think we are grilling. Here are some of my grilling essentials! Also, if you need to reset and check in with yourself, Iâ€™m hosting this workshop next month! If you need a boost to get re-motivated for 2025, join me next month for a Half-Year Reset Workshop. Half-Year Reset Workshop! 20% off for paid Substack subscribers Here are my Intentions for the Week: Intentions this Week This weekâ€™s intentions: Mind/Body morning pages/ morning routine 30 minutes no screen after wakeup fill out my Intentions for the week calendar keep track of what I eat in my food journal keep track of movement on Apple watch move body daily- break a sweat breath work work in Currently workbook check-in with calendar art time floss daily horoscope connect with my spirit work in my hobonichi cousin outdoor time/hike? pull cards/journal/video watch how much time I spend on the phone tweeze things paint nails do a hair treatment clean house + phone a friend use my diffuser eating meeting steam facial take vitamins stay hydrated read before bed quality time with my cats get enough sleep Work: intentions for the week i love lists record stuff my everyday life tracyâ€™s tracking tools post recipe binder class stuff SELF Check In! upload/edit photos recipe testing work on Currently Workbook post currently MAY work on THC clean up office package/ship orders for The Handwriting Club (THANK YOU!) catch up pinning on my Pinterest account Tailwind catch up on social media clean up workspace bookkeeping/pay bills emails go to P.O. Iâ€™d love to see your creations! Hereâ€™s a mood: Mantra for the week! Feeling stuck? Make a list! Write down your intentions for the week to help hold you accountable for action. My Intentions for the Week Calendar can help!! You can start it at any time of the year! I also have a printable if you work well with a one-sheet. Here it is in a binder. Itâ€™s part of my Time Management Printable pack! Need extra help? Join my accountability group: SELF-CHECK-IN We spend Sunday mornings 9:00 AM PST-10:30 AM- PST working on our calendars and checking in together. Those are my Intentions for the Week! Wishing you a productive week. Take good care of YOU! The post Intentions for the Week appeared first on Shutterbean.
excerpt: Intentions for the Week is a weekly TO DO list series on Shutterbean.com, created by Tracy Benjamin of The Handwriting Club. What started as a personal planning ritual turned into a structured planner designed to help you organize your week with intention, creativity, and accountability. Follow along every Monday for inspiration, productivity tips, and a space to map out your goals!

Intentions for the Week- Week 22 in 2025

Hi hiiiiii! Welcome to week 22!Â  How was your weekend? Do you have today off?

Did you have any time to yourself? (I spent all weekend with family)

Did you get to rest? (I had 6AM wakeups all weekend)

Did you do meal prep? (I cleaned out the fridge! )

Do you know whatâ€™s for dinner tonight?Â Â 

I think we are grilling. Here are some of my grilling essentials!

Also, if you need to reset and check in with yourself, Iâ€™m hosting this workshop next month!

If you need a boost to get re-motivated for 2025, join me next month for a Half-Year Reset Workshop.
